page.title: 14Farming:Ipplepen, Denbury.
page.content: Farms cover most of this area. They are{dairy and mixed farms.}Most of the farms are small and privately owned. There are some tenant farms. { Denbury has dairy farms around it, with large herds of Friesian cows. The milk, after cooling, is collected by tanker and taken to Totnes for pasteurising. { Some South Devon or Ruby Red}are farmed at Ipplepen. The farming is mixed dairy and arable. Many of the cattle in the fields are Charolais crosses. Sheep are reared on the short turfed grass on the higher ground. { Poultry}such as hens, ducks and geese are kept as second incomes. The eggs are sold at the pannier market, animals are bought and sold at the auction market Newton Abbot. Many farmers supplement their income by letting sites for holiday caravans.
